definition: Yeltsin (name)/Boris Yeltsin (1931-2007) first post-communist president of Russia 1991-1999
to respect/to admire/to venerate/by the emperor himself

sentences.english: Clinton told them he wanted to go as far as they could with Yeltsin.
sentences.chinese: 克林頓說他想走到他們能葉利欽與。

sentences.english: Russia reformer and former president Boris Yeltsin dies at 76.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯前總統葉利欽去世，享年76歲。

sentences.english: He became deputy to the head of Yeltsin\'s general-affairs department.
sentences.chinese: 他成爲葉利欽的不管部副手。

sentences.english: The ruble and the financial markets collapsed, and Yeltsin was a spent force.
sentences.chinese: 盧布和經濟一起垮臺，葉利欽是消費者。

sentences.english: Yeltsin gets a warm welcome during his presidential campaign visit to Kazan. (1996)
sentences.chinese: 葉利欽在他的總統競選期間訪問喀山，受到熱烈歡迎。

sentences.english: Yeltsin was polite and friendly, but slightly patronizing.
sentences.chinese: 葉利欽很客氣，很友好，稍微有點屈尊俯就的架勢。

sentences.english: Yeltsin raises a bouquet in celebration of his election win.
sentences.chinese: 大選獲勝後，葉利欽手捧著鮮花慶祝。

sentences.english: Yeltsin ruled out direct peace talks with rebel leader Jokhar Dudayev.
sentences.chinese: 葉利欽決定不與叛軍領袖杜達耶夫舉行和平談判。

sentences.english: He was different from Mr Yeltsin in age and temperament.
sentences.chinese: 普京與葉利欽在年齡和脾氣上都大不相同。
